title: Why was Azir nerfed on the PBE?
body:
Azir
Conquering Sands (Q) Sand Soldier damage increased to 75/105/135/165/195 from 60/90/120/150/180
Arise (W) AP ratios decreased to .6 from .7
Shifting Sands (E) shield value increased to 80/120/160/200/240 from 60/100/140/180/220

These changes amount to an overall nerf. Gaining 15 base dmg on Q a 6 second CD ability with max CDR while losing upwards of 65 damage late game on W his main damage source is a pretty significant reduction in damage.

Seems a bit ridiculous to nerf a champion whos currently underpowered.

You guys on the balance team probably are more educated than me on this matter, but I would make it so soldiers do less damage if there is more on the field, e.g. if you have 1 soldier, he has a 25% scaling, if you have 2 soldiers they have a 15% scaling each, if you have 3 they have a 12.5 scaling each. Of course those numbers are just made up, but you understand the concept. That way he still gets rewarded for having more soldiers (if you notice the numbers the overall scaling does increase per soldier) but he doesn't have the issue of being way to strong late game and way to weak early game.

On a typical start with a dorans (15 ap) and Glyph of ability power (1.2*9 = 10.8) or 3 AP quints (3*4.95=14.85) Azir W does 50+75%AP at level 1. So just each auto attack with let's say a modest 45 AP after masteries and runes is gonna deal  50+(.7*45) = 81.5 base damage. Now add in MR at lvl 1 of oh let's 45 which is roughly a 31% reduction in AP damage. So 81.5*.31 = 25.29 reduction OR You hit with roughly 56... keep in mind there's no Magic pen yet. 

So basically each hit you have with a soldier does 56 damage (likely more) on average. 

At level 2 you get Q. 
Q does 60+50% ability power... or  without all the math base is 67.5. After MRAbout 47. So your Q plus just one auto attack does a little over 100 damage. Most mid champs start out with what? Roughly 500-600 health? SO you need only land 3-4 Q+auto attacks to zone someone completely out. Keep in mind you're at a safe distance? I think we were find early game with the exception of being mana starved...which forces you to either go mana regen or go after a Rod of Ages early. 
This is a nerf overall in my opinion.
